data.title: Hungry Horse Dam — Cortney Foster

data.text:
Hungry Horse Dam and Reservoir is one of the most picturesque locations in Northwest Montana ideal for engagement and proposal photographs. The dam is one of the largest concrete dams in the United States and the below reservoir offers over 170 miles of shoreline to explore. This location is ideal for couples who want to avoid the national park crowds while still enjoying a scenic location.

Live in the moment. I’ll make sure to capture it.

find out more

Scenery & Photography Opportunities

There are numerous scenic areas to explore around the Hungry Horse Dam. The dam is located in the Rocky Mountains and is surrounded by numerous mountain peaks. Along the shores of the reservoir, there are multiple opportunities to take in the fresh mountain air and take in the moment.

The dam is fed from the South Fork Flathead River which also has numerous other offshoots and tributaries to explore. Down in the reservoir, there are numerous trails, camping spots, and scenic hideaways to enjoy. With over 23,800 acres of land to explore there are countless opportunities to spark romance and capture stunning images. I even know some phenomenal hidden away spots where huckleberry grows, which makes for some unique and beautiful photographs.

Things to do at

Hungry Horse Dam

The main hub for the Hungry Horse Dam is at the visitors center. Here, you can learn about the history of the dam, explore exhibits, and take a self-guided or guided tour of the dam. The visitors center is open to guests from 8:30am - 4:00pm from Memorial Day to Labor Day.

Past the dam, inside of the Hungry Horse Reservoir, is where the action really happens. Here, visitors can enjoy activities such as camping, fishing, boating, swimming, and scenic overlooks.

Hungry Horse Reservoir Camping

Inside Hungry Horse Reservoir, camping is one of the more popular ways to turn a day trip into a destination weekend. Throughout the reservoir there are multiple tent and RV campsites to enjoy and take in the beauty surrounding.

1. Lost Johnny Point Campground

Lost Johnny Point Campground offers 21 tent and RV campsites along the Hungry Horse Reservoir. This area has ease of access to fishing and swimming spots and each campsite also has a fire pit and picnic table.

2. Lid Creek Campground

With 23 different camp sites, Lid Creek Campground offers a boat ramp close by making it an ideal location for those bringing their boats along. This campground is also surrounded by the forest as well as huckleberry bushes making for some great scenery.

3. Emery Bay Campground

On the east side of the Hungry Horse Reservoir, Emery Bay Campground offers 26 sites, as well as two larger group sites to accommodate larger groups. Another added benefit to this site is drinking water is available on-site after June 15th.

4. Murray Bay Campground

With 20 overnight sites available, Murray Bay Campground brings campers right to the reservoir. This site also has two water pumps for drinking water as well as a concrete boat ramp inside of the campground for boating.

How to Get to

Hungry Horse Dam

The Hungry Horse Dam is conveniently located only 15 miles from Glacier National Park and 20 miles from the city of Kalispell, Montana. To get to the dam, visitors will get off of Highway 2 in Hungry Horse and take Hungry Horse Dam Rd about 4 miles. The visitor center is on the right before crossing the top of the dam.

To access the reservoir, there are two main roads to utilize depending on which side of the reservoir you wish to explore. Visitors on the east side will turn off Highway 2 onto Old US 2 and take a right onto Central Ave which turns into S Fork Rd also known as East Side Rd. While visitors on the west side will continue over the dam from the visitor center onto West Side S Fork Rd also known as NF-895. The roads together surround the reservoir.
